holidays.name: International Tourette Syndrome Awareness Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to raising awareness and understanding of Tourette Syndrome, a neurological disorder characterized by involuntary tics and vocalizations.
holidays.origin: Established by the Tourette Association of America to foster education and support for those affected.
holidays.funFact: Despite common misconceptions, people with Tourette's often have control over their tics to some extent and the condition varies widely in severity.

holidays.name: National Submarine Day (USA)
holidays.description: Celebrates the launch of the first successful military submarine, the USS Holland, marking a new era in naval warfare and underwater exploration.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the commissioning of USS Holland on April 11, 1900.
holidays.funFact: The USS Holland could stay submerged for up to 12 hours and traveled at about 6 knots underwater ‚Äì slow by today‚Äôs standards but revolutionary back then!

holidays.name: Pineapple Day
holidays.description: A quirky food holiday dedicated to celebrating the tropical fruit that's as sweet as it is spiky. Enjoy pineapple in all forms!
holidays.origin: Unofficial food day created by pineapple enthusiasts and fruit lovers to honor this delicious wonder.
holidays.funFact: Pineapples were so rare and expensive in 18th-century Europe that they were rented out as table centerpieces to display wealth and status!

holidays.name: Playing Card Day
holidays.description: A day to appreciate the design, history, and endless games that playing cards bring to the table.
holidays.origin: Originates from the resurgence of interest in traditional card games and their cultural impact worldwide.
holidays.funFact: The four suits in a deck of cards are said to represent the four medieval social classes: hearts (clergy), spades (nobility), diamonds (merchants), and clubs (peasants).
